_comment: Pattern Template for SubFast Episode Matching Tests
_usage: 1. Copy this template, 2. Fill in values, 3. Use validate_pattern_definition() to check, 4. Use add_pattern_to_definitions() to insert
_id_help: Next available pattern ID (e.g., 26). Must be unique.
name: [PATTERN_NAME]
_name_help: Short descriptive name for the pattern (e.g., 'S##E##', 'Episode.##.Season.##')
_description_help: Brief description of what this pattern matches (e.g., 'Most common format with S and E separators')

variations._var_id_help: Variation identifier - use VAR1, VAR2, VAR3, VAR4 for consistency
variations._video_template_help: Example video filename using this pattern (e.g., 'Show.Episode.5.Season.1.mkv')
variations._subtitle_template_help: Example subtitle filename using this pattern (e.g., 'Show.Episode.5.Season.1.srt')

variations._comment: Optional: Add VAR4 if you want a fourth variation

_example.comment: Here's a complete example for Pattern 26: Episode.##.Season.##
_example.name: Episode.##.Season.##
_example.description: Reversed order - Episode number before Season (e.g., Episode.5.Season.2)

_validation_checklist: ✓ Filenames are realistic and use the pattern
✓ Video and subtitle filenames match (same episode)
✓ File extensions are .mkv, .mp4, or .avi for videos
✓ File extensions are .srt or .ass for subtitles
_next_steps: 6. Run tests to verify pattern works
